reviews.text: Stunning art collection in the dining room! The food matches the ambiance - creative, beautifully plated, delicious. Brunch here is exceptional.
reviews.author: Alexandra P.

reviews.text: Great hotel restaurant with better-than-expected food. The bourbon flights are fun. Service was professional. Prices are on the higher end.
reviews.author: Daniel S.

reviews.text: Love the modern atmosphere and rotating art exhibits. The duck confit hash is my go-to for brunch. Coffee is excellent. Always a solid choice.
reviews.author: Melissa K.

reviews.text: Decent food but nothing extraordinary. Felt like typical hotel restaurant fare. The art is interesting though. Service was hit or miss.
reviews.author: Brian M.

reviews.text: Perfect spot for business lunch. Quiet enough to have conversation, food arrives promptly, menu has good variety. The mushroom toast is fantastic.
reviews.author: Catherine R.

reviews.text: Solid upscale dining. The patio is lovely in nice weather. Had the scallops and they were perfectly seared. Cocktails are creative and well-balanced.
reviews.author: Steven H.

reviews.text: Consistently good food and service. Great wine selection. The atmosphere is sophisticated without being stuffy. Highly recommend for special occasions.
reviews.author: Jennifer W.

reviews.text: Overpriced for what you get. Small portions, mediocre execution. Expected more from a well-known Louisville restaurant. Won't return.
reviews.author: Richard L.

reviews.text: The Sunday brunch is incredible! Extensive selection, everything is fresh and delicious. The pastry chef deserves recognition. Beautiful space.
reviews.author: Laura G.

reviews.text: Great downtown location, easy to find. Food is inventive and well-prepared. Service can be slow when busy. The art on the walls is worth the visit alone.
reviews.author: Timothy J.

reviews.text: Stayed at 21c and ate here three times during my visit. Never disappointed. The fried chicken sandwich is amazing. Staff is welcoming and efficient.
reviews.author: Angela B.

reviews.text: Very good food with interesting flavor combinations. Portions could be larger for the price. Atmosphere is hip and modern. Good for date night.
reviews.author: Christopher F.

reviews.text: Food was okay, nothing special. The art museum aspect is cool. Service seemed distracted. Might have been an off night.
reviews.author: Michelle T.

reviews.text: Farm-to-table done right. Ingredients are clearly high quality and locally sourced. Menu changes seasonally. One of Louisville's best restaurants.
reviews.author: Jonathan V.

reviews.text: Good for a business dinner or upscale date night. The burger is surprisingly good for a fancy restaurant. Bar service is excellent.
reviews.author: Rebecca N.

reviews.text: Everything here is thoughtfully executed. From the bread service to dessert, every course impressed. The sommelier gave excellent wine recommendations.
reviews.author: Andrew C.

reviews.text: Great spot for brunch. The avocado toast is elevated beyond the usual. Bloody Marys are well-made. Can get crowded on weekends.
reviews.author: Kimberly D.

reviews.text: Perfect combination of art, food, and atmosphere. Every visit feels special. The chef's tasting menu is worth every penny.
reviews.author: Edward M.

reviews.text: Nice space but food didn't wow me. Prices are high for the quality. Service was good. The art exhibits are the main attraction.
reviews.author: Diane S.

reviews.text: Outstanding in every way. Creative menu, impeccable service, beautiful setting. If you're only going to one nice restaurant in Louisville, make it this one.
reviews.author: Paul and Sharon K.
